meanings.definition: spurgalled (verb): past tense of spurgal - to confuse or bewilder
meanings.sent1: After the math test, Sarah felt spurgalled by all the difficult questions.
meanings.sent2: The loud noises and flashing lights spurgalled the puppy at the pet store.
meanings.sent3: The magician's spurgalled expression when his trick failed made the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the movie spurgalled the viewers, leaving them in suspense.
meanings.sent5: The intricate maze spurgalled the participants, making it challenging to find the exit.

meanings.sent1: The lost tourist had a spurgalled look on his face as he tried to read the map.
meanings.sent2: The spurgalled expression on her face indicated she was completely lost in the unfamiliar city.
meanings.sent3: The spurgalled squirrel couldn't decide which acorn to choose from the pile.
meanings.sent4: The spurgalled students stared blankly at the complex math problem on the board.
meanings.sent5: His spurgalled mind struggled to comprehend the intricate instructions for the experiment.

meanings.definition: spurgalled (adverb): in a confused or bewildered manner
meanings.sent1: She looked around spurgalled, unsure of which direction to take in the maze.
meanings.sent2: The puppy wagged its tail spurgalled, trying to make sense of the new environment.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they watched the duck walk spurgalled in circles.
meanings.sent4: The old man shuffled spurgalled through the crowded market, looking for his lost wallet.
meanings.sent5: The actor delivered his lines spurgalled, forgetting his next cue on stage.
